attributes.comment:
We are disheartened by the proposed increases in adoption-related fees, including the I-600A and
the fingerprinting fee. My wife and I are in the process of adopting our second child from China.
With our first, the wait for a match took about 7 1/2 months. Current time frames are closing in on
20 months, meaning that we would need to resubmit the I-600A application and fingerprints, and
pay an increase as well, because the current fingerprints are good for only 18 months. On top of
the $685 already paid, this would add another $830, for a total exceeding $1,500. For those of us
who lack the financial resources of a Madonna or Angelina Jolie, this proposed increase is very
disturbing. Many families make financial sacrifices to make the world a little better for a child who
would otherwise not have a family.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kenneth Felsher
